etymology.interpretation: The character 又(yòu) directly visualizes a right hand, making it easy to remember as it looks like a hand, with the two strokes suggesting fingers.

examples.chinese: 他以又轻扶古琴(他以又輕扶古琴)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ yòu qīng fú gǔqín.
examples.english: He gently strokes the ancient zither with his hand.

examples.chinese: 工匠精于雕刻(工匠精於雕刻)，全赖又灵巧施艺(全賴又靈巧施藝)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng jīng yú diāokè, quán lài yòu língqiǎo shī yì.
examples.english: The artisan excels in carving, all thanks to the dexterity of his hand.

examples.chinese: 书法家以又运笔(書法家以又運筆)，绘出墨香传世(繪出墨香傳世)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎjiā yǐ yòu yùn bǐ, huì chū mòxiāng chuánshì.
examples.english: The calligrapher employs his hand to guide the brush, producing calligraphic works that endure.
